  1. Embrace the Outdoors Southern Style — Welcome to Pelham, one of the fastest growing cities in Alabama. 
    Located in the foothills of Oak Mountain, our scenic neighborhoods offer a retreat from the busy world.

  1. Pelham Comprehensive Plan

    Come give critical input and feedback to draft goals and actions as the next step of the city's plan gets underway! Your feedback will help craft the vision for the future of Pelham. Read on...

  2. Pelham Business Council Meeting

    Please join Mayor Gary W. Waters, City Manager Gretchen DiFante and the City Council at the upcoming meeting of the Pelham Business Council at 11:00 am at the Pelham Civic Complex & Ice Arena. Read on...

  3. 5th Annual Pelham Palooza

    The City of Pelham invites you come “Embrace the Outdoors ~ Southern Style” at the 5th Annual Palooza in the Park outside at the Pelham Recreation Center, 2020 Pelham Park Boulevard, Pelham. Read on...

  4. Temporary Closure Pelham CIty Hall

    Pelham City Hall is temporarily closed due to the results of some preliminary air quality testing. Read on...

  5. Part-time/seasonal positions with the City of Pelham Racquet Club and Tennis Center

    The City of Pelham is currently accepting applications for the following part-time/seasonal positions with the City of Pelham Racquet Club and Tennis Center. Read on...

  6. Chandalar - Routine Inspections and Maintenance of Sanitary Sewer Lines

    Please be advised that the City of Pelham is performing routine inspection and maintenance of the sanitary sewer lines within a portion of the Chandalar subdivision over the next few months. Read on...

  7. Turn Your Attention to Fire Prevention

    In conjunction with the Alabama Fire Chief’s Turn Your Attention to Fire Prevention Campaign, the Pelham Fire Department will begin installing smoke detectors in residential structures within our city limits. Read on...

  8. Ballantrae Clubhouse is #1 in the State of Alabama

    Architectural Digest's The Most Beautiful Clubhouse in Every State in America rated Ballantrae Clubhouse #1 in the State of Alabama. Read on...

  9. Pelham Named the Best Place to Live in Alabama

    Pelham “Best Place to Live in Alabama 2018” City of Pelham named by MONEY as best place to live in Alabama AGAIN Read on...

  10. "The Best Place to Raise Kids"

    Bloomberg Businessweek named Pelham "The Best Place to Raise Kids" in Alabama. Full Article...

  11. "One of the Best Places to Live"

    Money Magazine names Pelham "One of the Best Places to Live" in 2013. Full Article...

  12. Advanced Disposal

    Advanced Disposal is proud to have been chosen by the City of Pelham to be the solid waste and recycling service provider. Please call 1.800.333.7736 for all trash/recycle pickup issues and replacement/repair of carts. Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx

  1. City Meetings
  1. Apr 15

  2. City Council Meeting

  1. Apr 16

  2. Pelham Business Council Meeting

    Please join Mayor Gary W. Waters, City Manager Gretchen DiFante and the City Council members at the upcoming meeting of the Pelham Business Council at 11:00 am at the Pelham Civic Complex & Ice Arena. All Pelham business owners are invited to attend. It is our continuing goal to work together to make Pelham a business friendly city.

  3. Plan Pelham Public Input Meeting

  4. Plan Pelham Public Input Meeting

  1. Apr 20

  2. Pelham Annual Easter Egg Hunt in the Park

    Come out and celebrate Easter with our annual Easter Egg Hunt on Saturday, April 20th. We will have approximately 10,000 eggs spread over the Youth Football Field at Pelham City Park. It's fun for kids of all ages and Parents as well. And we might have a surprise visit from the Easter Bunny as well.
  1. May 13

  2. City Council Meeting

  1. May 18

  2. 5th Annual Pelham Palooza

    The City of Pelham invites you come “Embrace the Outdoors ~ Southern Style” at the 5th Annual Palooza in the Park featuring: KIDZAPALOOZA ~ Inflatables, face painting, balloon artist, crafts, carnival games, rock climbing, bungee trampoline, hula hoopers, Macaroni Kids and a mechanical bull! LIVE MUSIC ~ The M’80's take the stage at 12:00 pm with family friendly fun 80's music. Bring your dancing shoes and relive your favorite songs, or bring a chair and just sing along!   1. Community Events
  1. Apr 16

  2. Pelham Comprehensive Plan Open House

    Come give critical input and feedback to draft goals and actions as the next step of the city's plan gets underway! Your feedback will help craft the vision for the future of Pelham.

  3. Plan Pelham Public Input Meeting

  4. Pelham Comprehensive Plan Open House

    Come give critical input and feedback to draft goals and actions as the next step of the city's plan gets underway! Your feedback will help craft the vision for the future of Pelham.

  5. Plan Pelham Public Input Meeting

  1. Apr 17

  2. Medicare Seminar

    Does Medicare confuse you? Get answers at a seminar provided by Linda Reynolds, an independent insurance agent with 15 years of experience. The presentation simplifies complex issues such as the Medicare parts, enrolling and more. Hundreds age into Medicare each month in this area. It is a complex and confusing process for most individuals. Attend this program and get the facts. The seminar is free and open to the public.
  1. Apr 18

  2. Spanish Conversation Table

    Do you speak Spanish but need the opportunity to practice with others? Did you take Spanish classes, study abroad, or go on missions’ trips to Spanish speaking countries? ¿Habla Spanglish? If so, join the Spanish Conversation Table! Our language conversation table offers the opportunity to practice with others. We’ll come together to practice and learn in a fun and casual environment. Registration is not required.
  1. Apr 20

  2. Pelham Annual Easter Egg Hunt in the Park

    Come out and celebrate Easter with our annual Easter Egg Hunt on Saturday, April 20th. We will have approximately 10,000 eggs spread over the Youth Football Field at Pelham City Park. It's fun for kids of all ages and Parents as well. And we might have a surprise visit from the Easter Bunny as well.
  1. Apr 23

  2. Wish Upon a Par Golf Tournament

    Lunch is at 11:30am in the grill area. Four man scramble begins at 1pm. Door prizes given out after the event. All proceeds go to Make A Wish Alabama!

Plan Pelham

Pelham's Comprehensive Plan

How do you imagine the City of Pelham in 5, 10 or 25 years from now? What issues are you currently facing as a resident or business that need to be addressed to achieve your vision of the future?  How can Pelham become more competitive to its surrounding communities? What actions are needed to make the next generation thrive in the community they inherit? 

Visit Plan Pelham to be a part of Pelham's future!

Beautification Board

The Pelham Beautification Board was established in 1995 and is one of the most active volunteer boards in the city.
